I do not think adding it into documentation is enough... Check for it or install it (I do not know the exact depends workings).\n
And as curl is needed for other archs, it should be inserted elsewhere anyway.\n

```
doc/build-windows.md:First install the toolchains:
```

We could do something like the following:

```
From 7deb7fc636717b6a0457039bf10d6c5b81076d3f Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Joseph Bisch <joseph.bisch@gmail.com>
Date: Sun, 7 Aug 2016 16:17:11 -0600
Subject: [PATCH] Depends: Check if curl is installed and error out if not

---
 depends/Makefile | 8 +++++++-
 1 file changed, 7 insertions(+), 1 deletion(-)

diff --git a/depends/Makefile

There is no plan to add curl to depends.
Initially we used wget which happens to be installed on ubuntu out of the
box.
Due to intermittent problems, it was switched to curl, which happens not to
be installed by default. As those docs refer to 'ubuntu vm', it makes sense
to mention that curl is needed.

I'd suggest to just add 'curl' to the `apt-get` line, this more copy-paste friendly:

```
First install the toolchain and curl:

     sudo apt-get install g++-arm-linux-gnueabihf curl
```

There is no hurt in installing it if it is already installed.

> I'd suggest to just add 'curl' to the apt-get line, this more copy-paste friendly:

Agree
